item.g:material: Polystyrene, cement, colored glass, smalt. 50х50 cm, 2022.

item.g:title: Infinite Mother
item.g:material: Sculpture (mosaics, clay, marble base). Height 32 cm, 2021.
item.g:description: Primitive Venus is a symbol of a life source. Mother is not only a life source. It is also beauty, aesthetics, pain, empathy, love – which have no end.

item.g:title: The Burial of a Country
item.g:description:
A country of dreams laid to rest – We were deceived by the dream of freedom. Now wings heavy with pain carry us off into exile. A sentence awaits us, Instead of hope.
If only I knew where I am. In se

item.g:title: Endless Revolution
item.g:description: Today is May 12, 2024. It’s been 1,372 days since my revolution began. For me, it should’ve ended 1,026 days ago – but it didn’t. I’ve heard the lectures and advice: almost four years have passed – it

item.g:title: By a Gust of Time
item.g:description: The lost revolution became a thick dividing line in how I perceive life. My subconscious pulled off an interesting trick – now, I experience myself as something that was born on the first day of the r

item.g:title: Dialogue With Myself
item.g:description: It seemed that in a world of burning car hoods, revolutions had already provided the answers – who is who, what each is willing to risk, and what they're truly worth. I liked discovering myself as a w

item.g:title: The Beautiful Faraway
item.g:material: Oil on duplicating ink on canvas, 50x50 cm, 2022
item.g:description: The childhood mini-series Guest from the Future left a deep impression on me. It instilled a kind of directive: change the world, make the future better. And now – the future has arrived. Instead of i

item.g:title: The Country of Houses On The Edge (meaning “I’ve got nothing to do with it”). Variation 1
item.g:description:
I remember how, on the barricades, the lights of the houses shone for us – sometimes they glimmered, sometimes they cried out, supporting all of us with their warmth. But it was all too brief.
Soon,

item.g:title: Original Sin
item.g:description:
The one who skillfully disguised himself as a victim demands ever greater pleasure, believing in his own chosenness.
And a new lamb is raised for the feast – by the very hand that once fed the kille

item.g:title: Split
item.g:description: This work isn’t about slogans or manifestos – it’s a snapshot of a strange state of mind that, I believe, many political exiles have experienced. Being ripped out of your familiar world in a matter of

item.g:title: Progressive Introversion
item.g:description: Disappointment in the hopes once placed. Inflation of former everyday values. A radical, mutual misunderstanding. Exhaustion from trying to explain. Mutual contempt... The end of all attempts to under

item.g:title: The City That Fell Asleep
item.g:description: An awakened dream perished before the night took hold. Eyes shut again – perhaps for long, dark years. The squares became overgrown with trembling weeds, And the cries of the streets fell silent in da

item.g:title: Demo-Democracy or 5OC1-ALR3-V0LU-T10N
item.g:description: Oil on canvas, 50x70 cm, 2020

item.g:title: PTSD
item.g:description: Two years after everything happened, I’m only now beginning to feel like I exist in reality again – tentatively starting to piece together some sort of future. Still, I wanted to capture the state tha

item.g:title: Homesick
item.g:description: Over four months in exile. Even though I think of myself as a person of the Earth, I miss it like hell. Białystok is beautiful and tidy, but I miss the piss-stained courtyards of Serebryanka:) I dream

item.g:title: Human Resource
item.g:description: The archon's ambition drains the body of Mother Earth, sucking the energy of our warmth. Their all-seeing eye steals our sun, and their mouths consume our voices. Take back what’s yours.

item.g:title: The Senior Advisor Reveals to the Common People the Miracles of Legitimacy
item.g:description: “You have to understand!” (c) In case the artwork is sold, 3% of the price will be donated toward burgers for the members of the Transitional Cabinet.

item.g:title: Dictator! Memento Mori.
item.g:description: Having lost its glossy stability, the ship of promises is now stuck in spilled oil. Moss slowly eats away at the mortal flesh of the Caesar. The rays of bravado have vanished into the womb of an eclip

item.g:title: The Land of Houses On The Edge (meaning “I’ve got nothing to do with it”). Variation 3
item.g:description:
We walked as one, our people, toward the sun – the sun that lit the path to our future.
Neither fear, nor sorrow, nor loneliness seemed strong enough to stop us. And yet, after some time, we found ou

item.g:title: Total War
item.g:description: War is everywhere – the air itself is thick with it. Those like us turn on each other, Not where the whole land is burning, Where silence drowns in the barking of dogs Instead of in conversation, in u

item.g:title: Sky of the Slavs
item.g:description: One of the pro-Russian rock bands has a song with a nationalist message, “Sky of the Slavs.” But in reality, the sky of the Slavs looks like a brick wall on which the power structures of totalitarian

item.g:title: Goyda
item.g:description: The painting depicts a warmonger and one of the main Russian exponents of imperialist ideas. The title of the painting refers to the battle cry that this character tried to promote to the masses durin

item.g:title: Coronation of the stomach
item.g:description: The opposition to authoritarian regimes often views sanctions as the main method of struggle, believing that the poorer the population, the more open it is to revolution. In reality, poverty is the ba

item.g:title: AWAITING UNAVOIDABLE GUESTS
item.g:description: I have been in exile for over a year now. I catch myself on the thought that I'm starting to forget what it's like to be THERE, inside a totalitarian regime. Therefore, I decided to record memories be

item.g:title: Conversation between me and us
item.g:description: What is "I"? It is essentially a self-sufficient person. A formed microcosm with its own flaws, but also advantages, achievements and reasons for pride. The identity has no need to encroach on someone

item.g:title: Collective portrait of Dorian Gray
item.g:description: The portrait of the state is the face of those who broadcast from the screens. This is a portrait of Dorian Gray brought to life. At first, they started with small lies. But they continued further, an

item.g:title: The hunter and the catch
item.g:description: It is believed that the main victims of patriarchy are women. But in reality, men suffer from it no less, becoming hostages of the gendered role of the breadwinner. After all, the “catch” is often low

item.g:title: Last call
item.g:description: This work is devoted to the role of schools in the work of propaganda and the inculcation of ideology. Teachers are one of the most dependent segments of the population, therefore, they are forced to

item.g:title: Creation of light and the seven circles of Belarus
PROPAGANDA WAITING FOR GODOT
item.g:description: For a long time I was interested in the phenomenon of Belarusian propaganda. In the case of Russian propaganda, it is obvious that people just want money, but the motivation of their Belarusian collea

item.g:title: RUSSIAN FEAST
item.g:description: Once again, the evil empire spread out the tablecloth for a bloody Russian feast. Once again, the meat grinders grind the mince without stopping. Once again, the empire gnaws the bones of its own and

item.g:title: PATRIOTIC CRAZE
item.g:description: Patriotism is a terrible wild plant when it grows on soil that is missing reason. Cheap vodka goes much better with some glorious history to snack on. If you have some rich culture on the side, it get

item.g:title: A WAY TO FREEDOM
item.g:description: The post-Soviet regimes are like the Minotaur, which drags the lives of young boys and girls through the labyrinths of the corridors of "justice" to be eaten. He knows no compassion, no mercy. It is i

item.g:title: COMFORT ZONE
item.g:description: It is not just rubber batons of the police that enslave people. A cozy sofa, an employment contract and a sweetly smiling bank employee who issues a loan for new equipment – these are the most widespr

item.g:title: CONCENTRATION FEST
item.g:description: Thousands of captive state employees flock to the main square of all the cities on every public holiday. The people come for bread and circuses - the pillars of political ideology. But the apex of the

item.g:title: THE CULT OF SUFFERING
item.g:description: It's largely a dark comedy, but occasionally propaganda manages to hit the sore points of the masses. Notice how propagandists often refer to the welfare of the opponents of the regime. “This one is a

item.g:title: THE STATE OF POMPOUS OPENINGS
item.g:description: Belarus (like many sovereign parts of the former USSR) is a country of Grand Openings! We have a tradition of solemn, pretentious opening ceremonies for anything - sports complexes and palaces, ramps,

item.g:title: ANOTHER MORNING
item.g:description: More than 2 years have passed since the failed revolution in Belarus, but the reaction from the regime does not stop. Every day, about 5 people are detained in the country for political reasons. “They

item.g:title: THE BASE OF THE PYRAMID
item.g:description: The authority of clubs is not as terrible as the freedom perverted by generations of people who reject any identity in favor of collectivism and basic needs. "What are you missing? Appreciate what you

item.g:title: THE SYSTEM LOVES SILENCE
item.g:description: This is a phrase I once heard while working in a school. If you think about it, it is a perfect ideological slogan of the post-Soviet dictatorships. These regimes came quietly, without civil warfare o

item.g:title: THE NEW HERO
item.g:description: The elevation of new heroes into the national pantheon has truly become a tradition. Hard times call for exulted verses. But heroes are individualists, they receive power, and don't really want to g

item.g:title: NESTED PEOPLE
item.g:description: Despite widespread collectivism, mutual responsibility and other attributes of an authoritarian society, the society in the post-Soviet space is extremely atomized and in the face of danger everyone p

item.g:title: STERILE CONTEMPORARY ART
item.g:description: In Belarus, there are "black lists" of artists who are deprived of the opportunity to participate in exhibitions because of their political position. A similar incident occurred at the annual "Autumn

item.g:title: AUTHOCRACY
item.g:description: Aυτός κράτος (Autos Kratos) – is a Greek term which developed into "autocracy". In the original, this term meant the sole and independent power of the ruler over all spheres of society. But in the con

item.g:title: STATISTICS
item.g:description: “Authoritarian countries are especially sensitive to statistics. Thousands of specially trained people painstakingly fill and overfill plans and schedules every month, and this never stops. Next month
